JOB SUMMARY

We are seeking a motivated Learning & Development (L&D) Intern (4-month internship) to support our L&D Manager in delivering key initiatives and projects. This is an excellent opportunity for HRD students in their final semester or recent HRD graduates to gain hands-on experience in corporate learning, instructional design, and training operations. The L&D Intern will assist in creating engaging learning content, managing basic LMS reporting, preparing internal communications, and supporting the team with various tasks related to talent development. 

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist in the development of guides, job aids, and training materials to support learning initiatives. 
Help create short e-learning modules or videos using provided tools and resources. 
Support basic reporting and tracking in the Learning Management System (LMS), including pulling completion reports and learner analytics. 
Draft and proofread internal communications, such as emails, announcements, or training updates. 
Perform audio recordings and light editing for training modules as needed. 
Provide general administrative support to the L&D Manager across various learning projects. 
Collaborate with subject matter experts (SMEs) to gather content and assist in designing learning solutions. 
Participate in team meetings and contribute creative ideas for improving learning experiences. 

Job Requirements
Current students in their final semester or recent graduate (within the past 12 months) from an HRD, Instructional Design, Organizational Development, or related program. 
Strong interest in learning & development, instructional design, or corporate training. 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
Basic proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint. 
Basic skills in Camtasia or similar tools for video editing and screen recording. 
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines. 
Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote environment. 
Willingness to travel to the Houston office on rare occasions, depending on project needs. 

Optional Qualifications: 
Ability to record and edit audio clips (experience with tools like Audacity, Camtasia, or similar is a plus). 
Comfortable with basic reporting tasks and working in learning systems (LMS experience is a plus). 

Additional Requirements 
As part of the interview process, candidates will be asked to submit a sample guide and/or video based on a provided topic to demonstrate their writing or content development skills. 

What We Offer 
Flexible part-time hours (Monday‚ÄìFriday, between 8am to 5pm, max 20 hours/week) 
Fully remote role with occasional, rare in-office requirements in Houston 
Exposure to real-world L&D projects and tools 
Hands-on learning experience with mentorship from an experienced L&D leader
